channel.title: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD
channel.description: Ok, i have a 500GB Maxter Onetouch4 HDD (http://www.maxtorsolutions.com/en/catalog/OT4/), and i already downloaded Ubunto and burned it onto a CD. I want to install Ubunto onto my 500GB drive, would i be better off installing Ubunto onto my C:/ or my new drive? I did get the sense to google it i found this (http://www.tuxmachines.org/node/22956), so the drive is NTFS formatted. Can i have someones opinion on what to do?

item.title: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:5, topic:182137”]Don’t do it.

It will be slow as fuck through USB.[/quote]

it won’t be slow as fuck… maybe if you had usb 1.0… and you have to have compatable hardware for a SATA harddrive… but sata is the fastest thing you can get… 3.0 gb/second transfer rate… IDE was the most common… btw… IDE is also refered to as ATA… i’ve got a 300gb hd, and i’ve used 150… high end games take about 1/4… 1/4 of it is programming stuff and source code… another 1/4 is my linux partition… and 1/4 is media… like music and videos… plus i have an 80gb as slave that is full… source code and back ups XD…

Read full topic
item.source: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD

item.title: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD

may i ask why you need 500gb HD?
[/quote]cuz my hd is shit.

i have a 90gb harddrive on my laptop and the most i ever used was 11gb, i had a lot of games too.[/quote]
Me 3. Cept I have a 288 Gig HD and Ive used almost 100.

item.title: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Install Ubuntu on your 30 Gb HD, but save and run programs from your 500 Gb HD.
Then will Ubuntu run faster.

The same with Windows if you use that, install it on your 30 Gb Hd.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

hmm ok, when you boot up your computer, it should say something like press [key] to enter setup… it is usually F2, F10, F8, or Delete, depending on your computer manufacturer… then go to uhh… the second tab or option listed, and find an option that says boot order, or boot priority, and find the option of USB - hdd or USB Device or something similar… it might only be there when the device is plugged in… i imagine if you google it you will find a better explained tut…

Read full topic
item.source: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD

item.title: Ubunto instalation onto Maxter Onetouch 500GB external HDD
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

vbcoderx:

hmm yeh, you gotta have a new enough computer that supports booting from external/ usb devices, then just change your boot order to have the usb device before your first hd… btw this belongs in the linux section

i have no idea whatsoever on how to do that, and well its about time i got in trouble again so what the hell.

Read full topic
